Definition: Percentage of reused water that enters the system
Calculation: (Total annual reused water/Total Annual available water)*100

Definition: Number of full time employees per unit of water produced
Calculation: (Number of employees/Total water produced (Mm3)

Definition: Percentage of employees dedicated to management, planning, PR with stakeholders, legal, internal audits, environmental management, IT
Calculation: (Administrative personnel/total personnel)*100

Definition: Percentage of employees dedicated to Personnel education, Safety, Medical services and social activities
Calculation: (HR personnel/Total personnel)*100

Definition: Percentage of employees dedicated to financial planning, administration, economic and material control
Calculation: Finance and Commerce Employees/Total personnel)*100

Definition: Percentage of employees dedicated to accountability, and PR with clients
Calculation: Costumer service employees/total personnel)*100

Definition: Percentage of employees dedicated to planning, constructing and maintaining infrastructure and facilities
Calculation: Technical services employees/total personnel)*100

Definition: Number of employees working on watershed and water resource management per volume of water produced
Calculation: Number of Water resource personnel/total water produced (Mm3)

Definition: Number of employees working on water treatment planning, design, construction, operation and maintenance per unitary volume of produced water
Calculation: Number of Water treatment personnel/total water produced (Mm3)

Definition: Number of employees working on the planning, design, construction and maintenance of system transport, storage and distribution network
Calculation: Number of  Network personnel/total water produced (Mm3)

Definition: Number of employees working on the monitoring, sampling and testing of water quality
Calculation: Number of Water quality personnel/total annual water quality test)*10000

Definition: Number of employees working on water meters management per 1000 meters
Calculation: (Number of metering personnel/total number water meters)*1000

Definition: Percentage of employees that hold at least a Bachelor's degree
Calculation: (Number of employees with Bachelor's degree/Total number of employees)*100

Definition: Percentage of employees that hold at least Lower secondary education
Calculation: (Number of employees with Lower secondary education/Total Number of employees)*100

Definition: Percentage of employees that do not hold a Lower secondary education
Calculation: (Number of employees without Lower secondary education/Total Number of employees)*100

Definition: Number of hours of training per employee per year
Calculation: Total number of annual training hours/Total employees

Definition: Number of work accidents that required medical attention per 100 employees
Calculation: (Total number of accidents/Total number of employees)*100

Definition: Number of absent days per employee per year
Calculation: (Sum of total absent days/Total number of employees)

Definition: Extra hours expressed as percentage of normal working hours
Calculation: (Sum extra worked hours in a year/ Sum of normal working hours in a year)*100

Definition: Percentage of daily volume of treatment per maximum volume of treatment possible
Calculation: (Daily water treated/Daily water treatment capacity)*100

Definition: Raw water storage capacity per volume of intake water into the system
Calculation: (Total raw water storage capacity (m3)/total daily water intake (m3/d)

Definition: Treated water storage capacity per volume of intake water into the system
Calculation: (Total treated water storage capacity (m3)/total daily water intake (m3/d)

Definition: Percentage of the maximum installed pumped capacity
Calculation: Total pumps usage/Total pumps capacity

Definition: Percentage of total pumping energy as reactive energy
Calculation: Total reactive energy/Total pumping energy*100

Definition: Percentage of total pumping energy recovered trough turbines
Calculation: Total recovered energy/Total pumping energy*100

Definition: Number of valves per network length
Calculation: Total vales in the network/total length of network*100

Definition: Number of hydrants per network length
Calculation: Toal hydrants in the network/total length of network*100

Definition: Number of sector meters per 1000 connections
Calculation: No. of sector meter/total connections*1000

Definition: Number of client meters per connection
Calculation: Total number of meters/total connections

Definition: Number of meters of per users
Calculation: Total number of meters/total number users

Definition: Percentage of automatic control units
Calculation: Automatic control units/total control units*100

Definition: Percentage of units operated remotely
Calculation: Remotely controlled units/total control units*100

Definition: Percentage of network (in length) that is inspected in a year
Calculation: Km of inspected network in a year/total Km of network

Definition: Number of leakages detected and repeated per unit of network length
Calculation: No. leakages detected and repaired/year)/total network length(Km)*100

Definition: Ratio of inspection of emergency electric systems per year in terms of nominal power
Calculation: Total energy capacity inspected (MW)/year)/Total energy capacity)*100

Definition: Ratio of electric equipment inspected in a year
Calculation: No. of electrical equipment inspected/year)/Total No. of electrical equipment)*100

Definition: Average number of vehicles available daily for operation and maintenance per 100km of pipe network
Calculation: (Sum Available vehicles per day/356)/Total network length (km))*100

Definition:
The total cost of pumping depending on flow, pump head, efficiency, price, and the time dura-
tion during which the considered pump is running.
Calculation: C(MU) = (Cf [kWh/m4]√ó Q[m3/s] √ó h[m] √ó p[MU/kWh] √ó t[h])/Œ∑[%]

Definition: The Velocity Reliability (VR) index measures how well the current velocity \( v_i \) stays within a defined acceptable range, bounded by \( v_i^{\text{min}} \) and \( v_i^{\text{max}} \). A VR value of 0 indicates the velocity is outside this range, while a positive value means the velocity is within acceptable limits.
Calculation:
VR = CASE
    WHEN v_i < v_i_min THEN 0
    WHEN v_i_min <= v_i AND v_i <= v_i_mean THEN (v_i - v_i_min) / (v_i_mean - v_i_min)
    WHEN v_i_mean < v_i AND v_i <= v_i_max THEN (v_i - v_i_max) / (v_i_mean - v_i_max)
    ELSE 0
END,
where v_i_mean = (v_i_min + v_i_max) / 2

Definition: Percentage of total registered complaints resolved
Calculation: Solved complaints/Total registered complaints

Definition: Percentage of operation and maintenance (O&M) costs that are recovered from the water sales
Calculation: Recovered value (MU) / Total OPEX (MU)

Definition: Percentage of the billed amount that is collected from water-supply-related  taxation and user charges
Calculation: (Total received payments (MU/y) / Total Billed water (MU/y))*100

Definition: Percentage of organoleptic tests carried out per required test
Calculation: No. of tests carried out/no. of tests required

Definition: Percentage of radioactivity tests carried out per required test
Calculation: No. of tests carried out/no. of tests required

Indicator: Public taps in service and standpipes
Definition: Percentage of public water taps that are not out of service
Calculation: Working taps/total taps in the system*100

Indicator: Average distance to public taps and standpipes
Definition: Mean distance between standpipe and furthest serving house to such standpipe
Calculation: (Sum max distance service)/total standpipes

Indicator: Consumption per capita in Public taps and standpipes
Definition: Ratio between supplied water in public taps and standpipes and the population it supplies
Calculation: Total volume supplied (L/d) in Public taps and standpipes/Total residents supplied by Public Taps and standpipes

Indicator: Population per public tap or standpipe
Definition: Average number of people supplied by public tap or standpipe
Calculation: (Sum People supplied per tap)/Total number of public taps

Definition: Percentage of connections that receive adequate water pressure
Calculation: Adequate pressure connections/total connection points*100

Definition: Average time of water availability when a user request for service on existing connections
Calculation: (Sum time for new connection/total new connections per year)

Definition: Average time of connection repairment
Calculation: (Sum time for repair/total damaged connections in a year)

Definition: Income per cubic meter of authorized consumption
Calculation: Total yearly income (M.U)/Total supplied water (m3)

Indicator: Ratio of lead or Asbestos service lines
Definition: Ration between the number of lead or asbestos service pipes in use vs the total network length
Calculation: Total length of lead pipes in use (km)/total length of Network (km)*100

Indicator: Drinking water storage per population supplied
Definition: Drinking water storage volume per population supplied
Calculation: ((Total service reservoir capacity (except emergency reservoirs) √ó 1/2 + Emergency reservoir capacity)/Service population) √ó 1,000

Definition: Distribution of network pipes in the total service area
Calculation: Total Pipe length (Km)/Total Servic area (Km2)

Definition: Percentage of capacity of purification facilities exceding useful life
Calculation: (Capacity of purification facilities exceeding statutory useful life/ Capacity of all purification facilities) √ó 100

Indicator: Aging of electrical and mechanical equipment
Definition: Percentage of capacity of electric and mechanical equipment exceding useful life cycle
Calculation: Number of electric and mechanical equipment exceeding life cycle/ Total number of electric and mechanical equipment

Definition: Percentage of pipe network exceding useful life cycle
Calculation: Km of pipes over 40years / Total Network length

Definition: Accidental water resource pollution
Calculation: Ratio of substituted meters in a year

Definition: Ratio of average daily supply to the dailyu capacity. The larger the value the higher efficiency
Calculation: Water Supply Volume per Day/ Daily Average WaterSupply Volume (m3)

Definition: Ratio of the longest to plannedin daily operation of facilities
Calculation: Water Supply Volume per Day/ Daily Maximum WaterSupply Volume (m3)

Definition: Ammount of CO2 emmissions per 1 m3 of delivered water
Calculation: Total yearly CO2 emmission (g) / Annual water delivered (m3)

Definition: Average daily water demanded in the city per day
Calculation: Hourly water demand (m3/h)/24h

Definition: Maximum demand in peak hour of the day
Calculation: Max hourly demand in 24h

Definition: Number of household users with low income provided with water
Calculation: Num low income HH supplied per year

Definition: Percentage of water consumed for residential porpuses in a year
Calculation: Residential comsumption / Total Water Consumption

Definition: Percentage of water consumed for commerce porpuses in a year
Calculation: Commercial comsumption / Total Water Consumption

Definition: Percentage of water consumed for industrial porpuses in a year
Calculation: Industrial comsumption / Total Water Consumption

Definition: easures the energy consumption per cubic meter of water pumped, per 100 meters of head (pressure height)
Calculation: Total Energy consumend(kWh) / (Total water extraction(m3)/ pressure height (m))

Definition: Percentage of city budget that gets invested in water supply
Calculation: Water supply budget / Total city budget

Definition: Percentage of city budget destined to disaster response mechanisms
Calculation: Investement in disaster response/ Total city Budget

Definition: Number of illnesess caused by poor water quality in a year
Calculation: No. reported illnesess cases / 1 year

Definition: Ratio between the stored volume and produced volume
Calculation: Stored volume (Mm3) / Produced Volume (Mm3))*100

Definition: Volume of water lost per unit length
Calculation: (Volume Supplied - Volume Billed)/Linear of Network (km) * 365

Definition: Used to evaluate the service flexibility for eventual in- creases in water demand. Its values range between 0 and 1, where values near 0 have small service flexibility to an increase in demands and values close to 1 correspond to systems with good service flexibility
Calculation: NRI = (Œ£[i=1 to N] U_i * Q_i * (H_i - H_i^req)) / (Œ£[r=1 to Nr] Q_r * H_r + Œ£[b=1 to Nb] (p_b / Œ≥) - Œ£[i=1 to N] Q_i * H_i^req)U_i = (Œ£[l=1 to np_i] D_l) / (np_i * max{D_1, ..., D_l})

Definition: Amount of chemicals used for the treatment of 1000m3 of water
Calculation: Sum chemicals used per year

Indicator: Apparent or commercial losses per connection per day
Definition:
Apparent losses consist of unauthorized consumptions (illegal connections,
unauthorized use of fire hydrants, meter bypassing, and poor billing collection system)
Calculation: Apparent losses (m3 per day)/no. of connections

Definition: Percentage of chlorine tests carried out per required test
Calculation: No. of tests carried out/no. of tests required

Definition: Estimated water consumption of water per person per day
Calculation: Yearly Water supplied/Total population supplied

Definition: Percentage of energy that comes from a source different to the main one
Calculation: ((Energy from main source + Energy from alternative sources) / Total Energy consumption) * 100

Definition: Percentage of water that comes from a source different to the main one
Calculation: ((Water main source + Sum(Water alternative sources)) / Total water available) * 100

Definition: Percentage of energy that is maintained throughout the network
Calculation: (Pressure end-node / Pressure initial-node)*100

Definition: Available drinking water per capita every year
Calculation: (Total water resources/year)/total population

Definition: Number of gate valves inspected in a year vs total number of valve gates

Definition: Number of hydrants that fail in a year compared to total number of hydrants
Calculation: No. of hydrant failures/total no. of hydrants

Definition: Number of hydrants inspected in a year compared to total number of hydrants
Calculation: Inspected/total number of fire hydrants

Definition: Percentage of imported water from transboundary/system input volume
Calculation: Total imported water / total annual available water

Definition: effectiveness of their water loss control efforts compared to an ideal state where only unavoidable losses occur
Calculation: (Current Annual Real Losses CARL/ Unavoidable Annual Real Losses UARL)

Indicator: Inline water quality monitoring equipment calibration
Definition: Number of calibrated sensors in a year per total number of sensors
Calculation: Calibrated/total number of inline water quality sensors

Definition: Total length of mains pipes that experience failures or bursts within a 1-year period.
Calculation: Length of mains with failures (km)/total mains length(km)

Definition: Total length of existing mains pipes that have undergone rehabilitation works (e.g., relining) during the reporting period.

Definition: Total length of mains pipes that have undergone renovation activities (e.g., repiping or major structural repairs) in the reporting period.
Calculation: Pipe length renovated/pipe length requiring renovation

Definition: Total length of mains pipes removed and replaced with new piping during the reporting period.

Definition: Ratio of substituted meters in a year

Definition: Percentage of HH whose water consumption is metered

Definition: Percentage of E. coli and total coliforms tests carried out per required test

Definition: Number of inspected zones in a year per total number of distric metering zones

Definition: Non-revenue water (NRW) is water that has been produced and is "lost" before it reaches the customer

Definition:
Percentage of the water supply points with functional water
meters

Definition: Percentage of physico-chemical tests carried out per required test

Definition: Average Number of hours with power failure per day of operation.

Definition: Perecentage of pressure meter readings verified and adjusted

Definition: Population using safely managed drinking water services

Definition: Effectiveness of meter‚Äêreading operations for residential customers.

Definition: Number of services connectios rehabilitaded compared to the total cases of damage

Definition: Number of hr in a day with minimum service standard

Definition: Number of flow meters calibrated in a year per total number of flowmeters

Definition: Number of water level sensors calibrated in a year per total number of Water level sensors

Definition: The proportion of the water network that is old and worn out.

Definition: Number of water quality equiment calibrated per year vs total number of water qualitiy equipment

Definition: The price of water tariff for households

Definition: Number of tanker filling stations failures per year compared to the total number of water points

Definition: Energy consumed by pumping and transmision of water in a year

Definition: Number of people working in the water company per 1000 connections

Definition: OPEX+CAPEX

Definition: Total volume of raw water extracted from all sources over a 1-year period.

Definition: Ratio of Effective water that reach the costumer to the total annual intake

Definition:
The number of actions carried out to improve the distribution network per km of network
improve the distribution network

Definition: The number of closures due to improvements actions per km of network

Definition: Percentage of income that comes from sales

Definition: Percentage of income that does not come from sales

Definition: Total operational expenditure per consumed cubic meter

Comment: (Ordinary expenses - (Commissioned workcost + Unused material and articlecosts + Auxiliary service cost))/Revenue water volume

Definition: Total capital expenditure per consumed cubic meter

Definition: Percentage of expenditure that is related to internal manpower

Definition: Percentage of expendiuture that is related to external services

Definition: Percentage of expenditure that relates to water imports (both raw and trated)

Definition: Percentage of expenditure that are not internal manpower or external services or imported water or electricity

Definition: Ratio between total income and total costs
Calculation: (Total income in a year/ total costs in a year)*100

Indicator: Contribution of internal sources to investment - CTI
Definition: Percentage of final investments that are financed trough cash flow

Definition: Ratio between total debt and total resources

Definition: Ratio of resource capacity to maximum daily transmition
Calculation: Total Supply volume per day/ Daily maximum water supply Volume

Definition: ‚ÄúFeels‚Äêlike‚Äù temperature expressing how hot it actually feels to humans, accounting for air temperature, humidity and wind speed.
Calculation:
AT = [0.89 x Ta] + [3.82 x (e/10)] - 2.56, where: Ta = Mean annual / monthly maximum temperature (¬∞C) (1976 - 2005)
e = Mean annual / monthly 3pm vapour pressure (hPa) (1976 - 2005)

Indicator: AWGBT - Aproximated Wet Bulb globe Temperature
Definition: An index that can be used for evaluating outdoor thermal stress conditions.
Measurement consists of a hollow copper sphere (90 mm diameter) painted mattblack, to absorb radiant heat, with a temperature sensor at its centre
Calculation: Direct measurement

Definition: measurement to analyze the accumulated cooling needs over a specific time period based on the climatic change of the outdoor environment.
Calculation: CDH = Œ£[k=0 to n] { (t_oa,k - t_b, if t_oa,k > t_b; 0, if t_oa,k ‚â§ t_b) }

Definition: It is an indicator improved by Chinese scholars based on the Temperature and Humidity Index (THI) which is a method for characterizing human comfort from the perspective of biometeorology
CTCS takes into account the extent, duration, and intensity of the thermal stress assessed by the UTCI, which could comprehensively evaluate the OTC of cities
Calculation: CTCS = (Œ£[i=1 to n] Œ£[j=0 to 9] (q_ij √ó w_j)) / n

Definition: Combination of temperature and humidity that evaluates how current temperature and relative humidity affect the discomfort sensation and cause health risk in the population
Calculation: DI = Ta ‚àí 0.55 (1 ‚àí 0.01 RH) (Ta ‚àí 14.5)

Definition: Apparent temperature index combining air temperature and relative humidity to quantify how hot it feels to the human body.
accessibility-based residents‚Äô heat exposure risk
Calculation: A_i^HIA = Œ£[j=1 to n] { S_j^HIA * (1 + NDBI_j) * [Œ£[k=1 to m] (D_k * f(d_kj))]^(1/2) * f(d_ij) }

Definition: evaluation model can estimate the heat island effect in a planned urban area using the planning indicators (building density, floor area ratio, green coverage, etc.
This indicator provides an aggregate picture of the total duration and weight of heat waves throughout a selected period
integrates both the length and the magnitude of a heat wave to calculate its overall strength
Calculation: HW_M = { (TX - TXx25p) / (TXx75p - TXx25p), if TX > TXx25p; 0, otherwise }

Definition: humidex is an equivalent dry-air temperature; air of a given temperature and moisture content is equated in comfort to air of a higher temperature which has a negligible moisture content
Radiant temperature of the ground/terrain as detected by thermal‚Äêinfrared sensors, representing the emission temperature of land surfaces.
Calculation: LST = T_B / (1 + (ŒªœÉT_B / ‚Ñèc)) T_B = K_2 / (ln(K_1 / L_Œª) + 1)L_Œª = 0.0003342 √ó DN + 0.1

Definition: Links effective temperature, which indicates the effects on comfort through air temperature and relative humidity, and an organism's thermoregulatory capacity.
Percentege of time over a year that an area meets a given set of Thermal comfort Accepatbility Criteria
park-type urban cold island is called PCI (Park Cold Island), and its effect intensity is characterized by the difference between the ground temperature inside and outside the park
Calculation: PCI = ŒîT = TU ‚àí TP

Definition: Percentage of people who would be dissatisfied with the climate conditions

temperature at any given place (outdoors or indoors) and is equivalent to the air temperature at which, in a typical indoor setting, the heat balance of the human body (work metabolism 80 W of light activity, added to basic metabolism; heat resistance of clothing 0.9 clo) is maintained with core and skin  emperatures equal to those under the conditions being assessed.
Calculation: f(Ta[C] VP[hPa], v_1.2 [m/s], Tmrt[], Work, Gender)
Comment: Ta = temperature, VP = Vapor Pressure, v_1.2 = Windspeed at 1.2m, Tmrt = Mean Radian Temperature

Definition: PMV index is a function of six variables: physiological variables and the rest are environmental variables. PMV index values range from ‚àí3 to +3, which describes the feeling of cold to hot
Calculation: [(0.303‚ãÖe‚àí0.036‚ãÖM)+0.028]‚ãÖ[(M‚àíW)‚àí3.05‚ãÖ(5.733‚àí0.007‚ãÖ(M‚àíW)‚àíPa)‚àí0.42‚ãÖ((M‚àíW)‚àí58.15)‚àí0.0173‚ãÖM‚ãÖ(5.867‚àíPa)‚àí0.0014‚ãÖM‚ãÖ(Ta‚àíTsk )‚àíhc(Tsk‚àíTr )]

Definition:
valuates dynamic changes in heat stress
based on Tmrt, a key meteorological parameter representing the impact of thermal radiation
on human thermal comfort
Calculation: RHSI = Œ£[i=1 to n] T_mrt(i) = { (i - 55¬∞C), if T_mrt(i) ‚â• 55¬∞C; 0, if T_mrt(i) < 55¬∞C }

Definition: mean interest rate charged on mortgage loans with a fixed interest rate over a defined period. It reflects borrowing conditions in the housing market.
Calculation: AFMR_y = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} r_{i,y}\text{where:} \quad AFMR_y = \text{Average Fixed Mortgage Rate in year } y, \quad r_{I,y} = \text{Fixed mortgage rate on loan } I \text{ in year } y

Definition: Indicator that relates vegetation, Equipment and Furnishing of parks. This is assumed as a proxy for Increased property value. Can be measured in Total Green/blue area, NDVI, % of land cover and/or green visibility
Calculation: PGQI_i = w_1 \cdot \text{NDVI}_i + w_2 \cdot \text{GreenCoverage}_i + w_3 \cdot \text{GreenVisibility}_i + w_4 \cdot \text{EquipScore}_i\text{subject to:} \quad \sum_{k=1}^{4} w_k = 1

Definition: Average monthly payment made by households on mortgage loans.
Calculation: sum of all mortgage repayments in month/Total mortages value

Definition: Average monthly rent paid by tenants.
Calculation: Sum of rents paid by households/ number of renting households

Definition: Costs of Water, electricity, waste incurred by a household per month
Calculation: Total services bills in month/Number of households

Definition: Sum of rent/mortgage payment and monthly costs
Calculation: Rent + Services

Definition: Mean commuting expenditure by cost of vehicle ownership and operational costs of commuting per unit of distance
Calculation: Vehicle amortization + (Operation cost [M.U./km]/distance commute [km])

Definition: Average monthly household spending on public transport.
Calculation: Total public transit fares paid in month/number of households

Definition: amount or percentage of income paid for rent or a mortgage as a cost of living
Calculation: Average monthly rent/average monthly disposable income *100

Definition: Available space in sqm per habitable room (excluding kitchen/baths)
Calculation: Total habitable area / Number of residents

Definition: Share of households in different tenure types
Calculation: Households in tenure type j / Total households *100

Indicator: Share of households reciving housing allowance
Definition: Refers to the size and number of rooms available for members of the same family in the same property and is based on age and gender
Calculation: Housholds receiving allowance/total households

Definition: Number of people per unit of land area.
Calculation: Total population / Land area

Definition: final consumption expenditure incurred by families for goods and services purchased to satisfy their needs and desires
Calculation: Housing costs/total household expenditure*100

Definition: refers to the total floor area within a residential unit that is heated, habitable, and finished.
Calculation: \text{Living Area} = \sum_{i=1}^{n} A_i   \text{where:} \quad A_i = \text{Area of each finished, habitable room}

Definition: Age of the dwelling at time of sale (time since original construction completion).
Calculation: Age s‚Äã =SaleYear s‚Äã ‚àíCompletionYear s‚Äã

Definition: percentage of the total number of housing units that are presently unoccupied
Calculation: Vacant units / Total housing units *100

Definition: Characterizes the relationship between residential land prices and macroeconomic development
Calculation: % change land prices/ % change GDP

Definition: Reflects the balance of residential land in the market
Calculation: X2 = Ri,j/ Ti,j Where X2 denotes the proportion of the residential land supply area in total land supply. Rij denotes the area of residential land supply in the county i in year j. Ti,j denotes the total area of construction land supply in county i in yea

Indicator: Degree of Marketization for residential land
Definition: Reflects the structural balance of market land supply
Calculation: X3 = ri,j/ Ri,j ri,j represents the area of residential land sold by county i through biddings, auctions, and listings in year j, and Ri,j

Definition: Reflects the structural balance of stock and new land use in the market
Calculation: X4 = Ci,j/ Ri,j Where X4 denotes the utilization rate of stock land, Ci,j denotes the stock land area of residential land supplied by county i in year j, and Ri,j denotes the total area of residential land supply in county i in year j

Definition: Measures the efficiency of land market allocation and the degree of land conservation and land use intensification
Calculation: = Ji,j/Ri,j J represents the planned area of residential Land and R denotates the toal area of residential land supply

Indicator: Per capita residential land supply area
Definition: Measures the balance of residential land supply and population scale
Calculation: = Ri,j / Pi,j Pi,j denotes the urban population in county i in year j, and Ri,j denotes the total area of residential land supply in county i in year j

Indicator: Proportion of land for affordable housing
Definition: Measures the supply of and demand for land for affordable housing
Calculation: X7 = Bi,j / Ri,j Where X7 denotes the proportion of land for affordable housing in total land supply, Bi,j denotes the area of affordable housing land supplied by county i in year j, and Ri,j denotes the total area of residential land supply in county i i

Definition: Reflects the degree of dependence on land finance and activity intensity in the land market
Calculation: X8 = Ni,j /(Ni,j+Mi,j) Ni,j denotes revenue from residential land sale in county i in year j, and Mi,j denotes the local general public budget revenue of county i in year

Definition: denotes the total area of residential land transactions in a Year
Calculation: Sum parcel area all transaction per year

Definition: Proportion of street network length with tree canopy or planted greenery visible from the road.
Calculation: Length¬†of¬†greened¬†street/ total street length

Definition: Price set by the seller (or real estate agent) when a property is advertised for sale.
Calculation: \text{Price}_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{Size}_i + \beta_2 \cdot \text{Location}_i + \beta_3 \cdot \text{Age}_i + \beta_4 \cdot \text{Bedrooms}_i + \beta_5 \cdot \text{Bathrooms}_i + \cdots + \varepsilon_i

Definition: represents the relationship between the total monthly incomes of a family, versus the amount owed on credit installments
Calculation: AER  = MP/HI √ó 100 || AER = AHV/HI x 100

Definition: Standardized price per unit area (e.g. ‚Ç¨/m¬≤) of land in a given zone, established based on official assessments, or market modeling.It serves as a reference value for taxation, planning, and real estate evaluation
Calculation: \text{LBP}_z = \frac{\sum_{I \in T(z)} P_i}{\sum_{I \in T(z)} A_i} \text{This gives a weighted average price per m¬≤ across the zone.}

Definition: Year-on-year growth in the urban resident population.
Calculation: Urban Pop t - Urban pop t-1 / Urban pop t-1 *100

Definition: developed by CIRI (Centro Interdipartimentale per la Ricerca Industriale) is focused on the enhancement and management of assets
Calculation: BQE i‚Äã = k=1‚àëm‚Äã w k‚Äã S i,k‚Äã , where ùëÜùëñ,ùëòS i,k‚Äã =score on criterion k and ‚àëùë§ùëò=1‚àëw k‚Äã =1.

Definition: Gross Floor Area (GFA), is the total floor area of a building measured to the outer walls (external faces), including all enclosed spaces on all floors.
Calculation: \text{GrossSurface} = \text{Footprint Area} \times \text{Number of Floors}

Definition: reflects thermal regulation in the human body based on a two physiological variables, skin temperature and skin wettedness
Calculation: Calculated via the RayMan/COMFA algorithm using inputs: air temperature, mean radiant temperature, relative humidity, air velocity, metabolic rate and clothing insulation; output is the equivalent reference temperature (¬∞C) at 50 % RH.

Definition: a model that can directly predict outdoor thermal comfort by increasing clothing thermal resistance and metabolic rate based on the PET index
percentage of an outdoor space that is within the desired thermal comfort range at least 50% of the time considered
Calculation: Area with acceptable OTCA / Area Total

Indicator: SUHII - Surface Urban Heat Island Intensity
Definition: Difference in land‚Äêsurface temperature between urban areas and their surrounding rural reference, quantifying the extra heating due to urbanization.
Calculation: (LSTi - Avg LST)

Indicator: SUHIIen - Surface Urban Heat Island pixel Enhancement
Definition: indicator aims to high-light pixel-level SUHII variations across the whole urban area through explicitly accounting for the heating or cooling influences of neighboring pixels on center pixels based on a kernel convolution process
Calculation: SUHIlen[x,y] = (SUHIlen[x,y] - SUHIlen_ave) / (SUHIlen_max - SUHIlen_ave)

Definition: Is a combination of temperature and humidity that represents an individual's level of discomfort in warm weather
Calculation: THI = 0.8T + (RH x T)/500

Definition:
Uniform surrounding temperature in an imaginary enclosure in which the radiant
heat transfer from a human body to the enclosure surfaces is equal to
the heat transfer to the surfaces of an actual enclosure with non‚Äì
uniform temperatures
Number of nights with temperature above 20¬∞C
Calculation: Direct Measurement

Definition: average deviation of PET from the acceptable thermal comfort range at each space
Calculation:
TSI=(1/K-1)‚àô„Äñ‚àÜT„Äó_crit
where K, the scaling factor between 0 and 1 is computed as 
K=1/N ‚àë_(k=11)^16‚ñí„Äñ m_k „Äó
m_k={‚ñà(     1„Äñ        if |‚àÜT|‚â§ ‚àÜT„Äó_crit@„Äñ‚àÜT„Äó_crit/|„Äñ‚àÜT„Äó_k |             otherwise)‚î§
„Äñ‚àÜT„Äó_crit is the acceptable temperature range (A) from the midpoint defined as

And „Äñ‚àÜT„Äó_kis the difference of the thermal comfort index (i.e. PET) at any timefrom the midpoint of the thermal comfort acceptable range (A), as described by Heng & Chow (2019)
„Äñ‚àÜT„Äó_k=PET- (A_max+A_min )/2

Definition:
index was developed and validated under Singapor outdoor thermal conditions The model uses
four input variables (air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, and mean radiant temperature
Calculation: TSV = respondent‚Äôs rating on the ASHRAE 7-point scale: ‚Äì3 Cold, ‚Äì2 Cool, ‚Äì1 Slightly cool, 0 Neutral, +1 Slightly warm, +2 Warm, +3 Hot.

Definition: Wmax establishes a clear thermodynamic limit on heat transfer that cannot be offset by adaptations. Higher values of Twmax imply hot and humid conditions while lower values indicate less extreme conditions.

Indicator: UHI index - Urban Heat Island Index
Definition: Normalized value of Difference between Measured tempearature and the minimum value in the spatial extense.
Calculation: (LSTi - LSTmin)/(LSTmax - LSTmin)

Definition: Difference of temperature between area affected by UHI and the surrounding rural area
Calculation: (Avg T LST urban - Avg LST surrounding area)

Indicator: UHImax - Maximum UHI intensity in 1 hour
Definition: max(Turban‚Äâ‚àí‚ÄâTrural) from 1-h average data
Calculation: UHII_max = a * (‚Å¥‚àö(SR * DTR¬≥ / U))      a = 2 - SVF - F_veg

Definition: indicator of the extent to which an urban meteorological station is influenced by winds traversing the built-up part of the city, and depends on the frequency distribution and the path length of winds of each wind directions across the city before reaching the meteorological station, summed over all wind directions
Calculation: U_ii = Œ£(K_i √ó F_i), where K_i = (L_1 / (L_1 + L_2)) √ó (L_1 / L_max)

Definition: Indicator that building height, Sensible heat, High termal inertia and antrophogenic heat flux
Calculation: f( WH‚Äã ,Œ≤,ŒîQ S‚Äã ,Q F‚Äã )

Definition: Percentage of city area that is within the effects of Urban Heat Island
Calculation: (Sum(Area UHI)/Area City)

Indicator: URI - Urban Heat Island ratio Index
Definition: Ratio of UHI area to urban area with the consideration of weightedvalues of each temperature level .The greater the URI , themore intense the UHI is
Calculation:
URI = (1/n) * Œ£[i=1 to n] (œâ_i * p_i) Where n is number of reclassified temperature value levels, usually
n is defined as 6 levels; i is the temperature value level range 1‚Äì6; w is a
weight using the temperature value of corresponding level i; p is the
percentage of level i occupying throughout the image scene

Definition: Multi‚Äêparameter index quantifying human thermal stress in outdoor environments, based on a dynamic thermophysiological model incorporating air temperature, humidity, wind and radiation
Calculation: UTCI=f(T a‚Äã ,RH,v,T r‚Äã ,K ‚Üì‚Äã )

Definition: combined measure of temperature and humidity effects on thermal comfort
Calculation: 0.7T wb‚Äã +0.2T g‚Äã +0.1T a‚Äã
Comment: ùëáùë§ùëè  : Natural wet-bulb temperature (¬∞C), ùëáùëî  : Black globe temperature (¬∞C),Ta : Air temperature (¬∞C)

Definition: Number of nights with temperature above 17¬∞C
Calculation: Direct Measurement

Definition: Percentage of GDP that corresponds to Household debt
Calculation: (Total household debt/GDP)*100

Definition: Share of property transactions in which the buyer is an investor (not an owner-occupier).
Calculation: Number of investor purchases/total sales per year *100

Definition: Percentage of population that change homes in a year
Calculation: Number of total movers in year / total population

Definition: Median ammount of years that a family owns a same place
Calculation: Median Move out - Move in date length for owner occupied household

Definition: number of residential units that have reached construction completion. These units are ready for occupancy, regardless of whether they are sold, rented, or still vacant.
Calculation: NHU_y = \sum_{i=1}^{n} U_{i,y}\text{where:} \quad NHU_y = \text{Total number of new housing units completed in year } y, \quad U_{I,y} = \text{Units completed in project } I \text{ during year } y

Definition: Percentage of GDP that corresponds to Investment in housing
Calculation: Total residential investment/ GDP *100

Definition: Number of homes destroyed by disasters or urban renovation
Calculation: LHS y‚Äã =‚àëUnits¬†demolished y‚Äã +‚àëUnits¬†lost¬†to¬†disaster/re‚Äã

Definition: Difference between new housing units and houses losts
Calculation: Sum(Completitions in year) - Sum (Lost Housing in year)

Definition: the ratio of home prices to annualized rent in a given location. is used as an indicator for whether housing markets are fairly valued, or in a bubble.
Calculation: RTP_i = \text{AnnualRent}_i \cdot \frac{1}{K} \sum_{j=1}^{K} \text{HomePrice}_j

Definition: nominal house price index divided by the nominal disposable income per head
Calculation: PIR = HP/HH_income

Definition: Asking price of a property per unit of area, typically expressed as currency per square meter (e.g., ‚Ç¨/m¬≤).
Calculation: \text{Unitary Listing Price} = \frac{\text{Listing Price}}{\text{Property Area (m^2)}}

Definition: Joint indicator of four sub indicators: overall satisfaction with the community environment, Word of mouth about community, overall saisfaction with housing unit, overall satisfaction with public facilities
Calculation: RS i‚Äã = 41‚Äã (S i,comm‚Äã +S i,wom‚Äã +S i,unit‚Äã +S i,pub‚Äã )

Definition: Avg ( Water and electric supply + Match of house with occupant cultural WoL +  Aesthetic apperance of residences + Location of dwelling + Ammenities (toilet, kitchen, bathroom, washing areas)
Calculation: QD_i = \frac{1}{5} \left( WS_i + CM_i + AA_i + LD_i + AM_i \right)\]\text{where:}\quad\begin{cases}WS_i = \text{Water and electricity supply score} \\CM_i = \text{Cultural match with way of life} \\AA_i = \text{Aesthetic appearance score} \\LD_i

Definition: Avg (Education facilities + Open recreaction + commercial facilities + Healthcare faciliteis + Efficiency of infrastructural services + Social relationships + Accesibility and connectivity + Safety and security)
Calculation: QC i‚Äã = 71‚Äã  k=1‚àë7‚Äã C i,k‚Äã , where ùê∂ùëñ,ùëòC i,k‚Äã =score on context domain k.

Definition: Subjective: My life is close to my ideal here + The conditions of my life here are excellent + I am satisfied with my life here + So far I have gotten the important things I want in life + If I could relive my life I would prefere to stay here
Calculation: QL i‚Äã = 51‚Äã (L1 i‚Äã +L2 i‚Äã +L3 i‚Äã +L4 i‚Äã +L5 i‚Äã ) where each ùêøùë•ùëñLx i‚Äã  is a standard survey response.

Definition: Average reduction from listing price to sale price, as a share of the listing price.
Calculation: ((Listing price - Sale price)/Listing price *100

Definition: Number of average-priced homes affordable with one household‚Äôs annual disposable income.
Calculation: PPC = \frac{ER}{MR} \cdot ITP \cdot [ 1 - \frac{1}{(1 + MR)^D}

Definition: Percentage of the city area that is in the urban classification
Calculation: UR = \frac{Urban}{Urban+Rural || Total Area}

Definition: Quantifies the diversity of land-use types within a defined area. It is calculated as the ratio of the entropy (a measure of randomness or uncertainty) of the land-use distribution to the maximum possible entropy for the given number of land-use categorie
Calculation: \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{k} p^i \ln(p^i)}{\ln(k)} Where:ùëùùëñp i  is the percentage of each land-use type in the buffer areaùëòk is the total number of land-use types.

Definition: measures the changes in the transaction prices of dwellings purchased by households
Calculation: \text{HPI}_t = \frac{\text{Average Price}_t}{\text{Average Price}_{\text{base}}} \times 100

Definition: Count of newly approved home-purchase loans or credits in a calendar year.
Calculation: Count of mortgage or housing-credit agreements registered in year.

Definition: Number of housing units sold each month.
Calculation: Count of completed residential sale transactions in each month.

Definition: Average number of months a property is listed for sale
Calculation: ‚àë(SaleDate‚àíListDate)‚Äã / Number sales

Definition: Distance to facilites like markets, greenspace, work, gas station, transport node, hospitals, etc
Calculation: \text{Straightness}_i = \sum_{j \in G - \{i\};\ d[i,j] \leq r} \frac{\delta[i,j]}{d[i,j]}

Definition: Average number of housing units per sqkm in urbanized areas.
Calculation: Total units in area /Total area km2

Definition: Percentage of housholds living in their own home
Calculation: Owner occupied households /  Total households *100

Definition: Percentage of housholds having permanent house
Calculation: Households in permanent housing / Total households *100

Definition: Number of housing units delivered or made available by government or non-profit/public agencies during the period.
Calculation: POHS y‚Äã =‚àëPublic-sector¬†units¬†complet

Definition: Share of comfortable housing in the total housing stock
Calculation: Comfortable units / Total units *100

Definition: Proportion of families registerd as needing housing from the total number of families
Calculation: Reisgtered social housing applicants/ Total Families * 100

Definition: Proportion of families who received social housing
Calculation: Households¬†housed¬†in¬†social¬†units / Eligeble households *100

Definition: Effective tax paid by sellers (stamp duty, capital gains) as a share of sale price.
Calculation: Total seller taxes / Sale price *100

Definition: proportion of each of the thirteen service facility types
Calculation: Ei = ‚àëik=1 pi ln(pi )  ln(k) where Ei represents the commercial diversity of unit i, pi is the proportion of each of the thirteen service facility types in unit i, and k is the number of facility types (with k = 13).

Definition: Road length per area of analysis
Calculation: Total road length / total area

Definition: Average house inflation over the years
Calculation: HPIt - HPt-1 / HPIt-1 *100

Definition: Share of mortgage interest payments that is tax-deductible.
Calculation: Deductible interest / Total Interest paid *100

Definition: Share of total construction workforce employed specifically on residential‚Äêhousing projects.
Calculation: Housing sector construction jobs / total construction jobs

Definition: Proportion of family wealth that is stored in real state
Calculation: Value of real estate assets / Total household assets *100

Definition: Eflects the purchasing power of a representative household,  which is largely determined by the mortgage component, as households finance their house purchases with a large fraction of debt
Calculation: \frac{B_t}{P_t} = \gamma \frac{Y_t}{P_t} [ \frac{1 - (1 + R_t)^{-T}}{R_t} ]

Definition: Relative movement of house prices compared to general consumer inflation.
Calculation: HPI/CPI

Definition: Relative movement of house prices compared to building-cost inflation.
Calculation: HPI/CCI

Definition: Composite index tracking changes in average rents over time (base year = 100).
Calculation: Weighted average rent in period √∑ Weighted average rent in base period √ó 100

Definition: How many buildings are reachable within a given network radius ùëür from location ùëñi, weighted by the size (floor area) ùëä[ùëó]W[j] of each building.
Calculation: \[ \text{Reach}'[i] = \sum_{j \in G - \{i\};\ d[i,j] \leq r} W[j] \]

Definition: Measures "attraction" by combining building size ùëä[ùëó]W[j] and the distance decay effect ‚Äî farther buildings count less
Calculation: \[\text{Gravity}'[i] = \sum_{j \in G - \{i\};\ d[i,j] \leq r} \frac{W[j]}{e^{\beta \cdot d[i,j]}}\]

Definition: How often location ùëñi lies on the shortest paths between pairs of other locations ùëój and ùëòk.
Calculation: \[\text{Betweenness}'[i] = \sum_{j \in G - \{i\};\ d[I,j] \leq r} \frac{\eta_{jk}[i]}{\eta_{jk}} \cdot W[j]\]

Definition: Inverse of the average weighted distance to all reachable destinations.
Calculation: \[\text{Closeness}'[i] = \frac{1}{\sum_{j \in G - \{i\};\ d[I,j] \leq r} \left( d[I,j] \cdot W[j] \right)}\]

Definition: Annual net migration (in-minus out-migrants) relative to average population.
Calculation: ((In - Out) /((POPy - POPy-1)/2)*100

Definition: Total market value of all commercial‚Äêsector housing transactions in a period.
Calculation: ‚àëSale¬†value i‚Äã  for all residential/commercial transactions

Indicator: Total sales area of commercial housing
Definition: Cumulative gross floor area (m¬≤) of residential units sold in the commercial (non-subsidized) housing market during the period.
Calculation: Sum Area of units

Indicator: Numer of real state offers per year
Definition: Total count of property sale listings (offers) advertised over a year.
Calculation: Count of distinct sale offers posted in the year

Definition: Total count of rental property listings (offers) advertised over a year.
Calculation: Count of distinct rental offers posted in the year

Definition: Share of newly completed units that are intended for rental (market or subsidized) rather than sale.
Calculation: Rental unites completed / total units completed

Definition: Average house price divided by the typical down-payment amount.
Calculation: Average house price / Average downpayment

Definition: Share of annual disposable income required for the down-payment on an average home.
Calculation: Average downpayment / Average annual disposable income *100

Definition: Share of the property value financed through a mortgage.
Calculation: Mortage principal / Property value *100

Definition: Number of median‚Äêincome years required to fully fund an average home-remodel project.
Calculation: Average remodeling cost / Median annual income

Definition: Share of household income used to service all debt obligations (mortgage plus other loans).
Calculation: Annual debt payments / Annual disposable income *100

Definition: Average concentration of PM2.5 SO2, O3
Number of recorded crimes on public space per 100 inhab
Calculation: Crimes/population *100

Definition: Composite of sidewalk coverage, intersection density, block size, and land-use mix, indicating pedestrian friendliness.
Calculation: WI i‚Äã =w 1‚Äã SidewalkCov i‚Äã +w 2‚Äã IntDen i‚Äã +w 3‚Äã BlkSize i‚Äã +w 4‚Äã Mix i‚Äã ,
